title: Transformations in the Plane
content:
Module 3, Lesson 7: Transformations in the Plane

The Hook

This lesson covers Transformations in the Plane within the broader study of Geometry Fundamentals. Mastering these concepts will give you a solid foundation for subsequent lessons and real-world applications.

The Concept

1. Core Definitions

We begin with precise definitions that form the bedrock of Transformations in the Plane. A rigorous understanding of terminology prevents ambiguity and enables exact communication and proof.

2. Fundamental Theorems and Results

The central theorems of Transformations in the Plane provide powerful tools for solving problems. We state each result clearly, explain the intuition behind it, and work through representative examples.

3. Worked Examples

Each concept is illustrated with step-by-step worked examples. Pay close attention to the reasoning at each step — it is as important as the final answer.

4. Common Misconceptions

Students often confuse closely related ideas in Transformations in the Plane. We highlight these distinctions explicitly so you can avoid common errors in exams and practical work.

The Illustration

You have completed the study of Transformations in the Plane in Module 3 (Geometry Fundamentals). The key ideas covered in this lesson will be built upon in subsequent lessons. Attempt the quiz to consolidate your understanding before moving on.

quiz.question: A reflection of point (3,2) about the y-axis gives:
A rotation of 90° anticlockwise maps (x,y) to:
A translation by vector (3,–2) maps (1,4) to:
An enlargement with scale factor 3 multiplies all lengths by:
Which transformation preserves shape and size?
